plugins.name: Mode Inspector (Beta)
plugins.description:
📢 Request for feedback!

Hi all! This is a very simple Dev Mode only plugin that I built to help a very simple use case around showing translations stored in other variable modes.


I'm really keen to add more to it but to do that I'll need you to give direction around other things functionality you'd like the tool to have.


Please leave a comment or fill out this feedback form if you have any suggestions!


Plugin Description

Fairly lightweight plugin that allows developers to see variable values in different modes, without needing edit access, and without needing designers to duplicate every piece of UI just so they can extract data.


This is especially useful for things like translation, if you have a need to pull out strings one by one.


Note: This is currently in Beta and only supports string variables at the moment. If you have another need, or any feedback on how it currently works, please let me know!

accepted.name: Baffour Atuah
accepted.description: Designer, Developer, Candlestick Maker

plugins.tagline: View variable values for different modes, without leaving Dev Mode

plugins.name: In-App Browser
plugins.description:
Browse the websites inside Figma. It also saves the last link you open.


Warning: Many websites might look empty because they only work with real browsers (iframe restriction).


How to use

  1. Paste the url that starts with https://
  2. Press Enter or click the Arrow icon
  3. Drag the bottom-right corner to resize
  4. Click the menu icon (triple dots) to customize settings


Tips

  1. Click any Text on the canvas that has a valid link to auto-fill the address bar

plugins.name: Babel Translations
plugins.description:
The plugin uses DeepL API to automatically translate nodes or screens in Figma. v1.0


Prerequisites

Free version of DeepL API has a limitation of 500.000 symbols which you can translate, the plugin provides you an option to use your own subscription plan (Free, Pro or Enterprise) by providing an AuthKey during the onboarding process.


Supported Features

  • Free for all. You don't pay for the plugin itself as well as for basic version of DeepL, but I would be happy if you would like to buy me a coffee.
  • Translate one or multiple selected *visible* nodes including their children.
  • Use "formality" option to translate to a more formal or informal language.
  • Use "Auto" option to automatically detect the language of the text to translate from.
  • Automatically saves the language you were translating 'from' and 'to', to speedup the process.
  • Ignore certain Text nodes by adding a keyword `:babel_ignore:` to their name.
  • Handles errors gracefully.
  • Handles loss of connection gracefully.


Roadmap

Version 1.0 of the plugin covers only necessary features for an effective translation workflow, but we are using the plugin internally at BearMinds and we see many features which would make it even better.

  • Keep styles of the original text.
  1. bold, italic, underline
  2. font size
  3. font family
  4. color
  • Option to ignore certain group of nodes when translating.
  • split_sentences option to sets whether the translation engine should first split the input into sentences
  • tag_handling option to support html and xml tags
  • preserve_formatting option to preserve formatting of the original text, even if it would usually correct some aspects.
  • ignore_tags option to ensure that elements in the original text are not altered in the translation (e.g., trademarks, product names)
  • Detect that component is selected and warn about potential breaking changes propagation.
  • Translate a lot of text at once (e.g. 10000x symbols)


Feedback

We would be happy to hear about your experience with the plugin, missing features or issues. Just write to hello@bearminds.com.
plugins.tagline: Speed up processes by automatically translating components using the power of the DeepL

plugins.name: Trados Translation Connector for Figma
plugins.description:
You've got content to translate and you want to do it directly from Figma – quickly, easily and efficiently. All it takes is to connect Figma to the world's most-used translation technology: Trados.


Trados is a next-generation translation platform that uses AI and other smart technologies to make localization processes more agile and secure. Businesses with global growth ambitions use Trados to streamline and automate their localization workflows, manage translation resources more effectively and securely, and improve brand consistency. Through Trados you can send content to any language service provider, in-house or external.


This Trados translation connector easily connects Figma to your Trados solution to create a seamless end-to-end process for localization. Users of Figma can then easily push content to Trados and receive the localized content back once translated. They have visibility of the whole process and control over the elements they need, including cost approval and review. It couldn't be simpler.

accepted.name: RWS Group
accepted.description:
A unique, world-leading provider of
technology-enabled language, content and intellectual property services.

plugins.tagline: Trados is a next-generation translation platform

plugins.name: Format AI
plugins.description:
Edit text as intended with Format.

Spellcheck, change text length and format text instantly with Format.


AI Features

  • Spellcheck: Say goodbye to typos and errors!
  • Text Length Control: Easily shorten or extend text to fit your layout requirements.
  • Text Auto-Adjust: Rewrite text so that it fits its textbox.
  • Text Format: Transform messy text into well-organized structure.
  • More features coming soon!


Basic Features

  • Merge multiple nodes into a single text node.
  • Split text node by line breaks.
  • Remove styling from multiple text nodes (hyperlinks, underscores and strikethroughs).


Instructions

  1. Select your text nodes.
  2. Open Quick Actions [Ctrl + /] or [Cmd + /].
  3. Type a command (e.g. Merge or Split).
  4. Press Enter/Return.


Reach Out

We are currently working on new features and would be happy to hear your suggestions. Please write us at inbox@debrief.design
plugins.tagline: Working with text made easy

plugins.name: Variables Lint
plugins.description:
Variable Lint is Figma plugin to help in variable management and streamline design consistency.


Key Features:


Variable Stats: Gain valuable insights into variable usage with detailed statistics, including:


Track Assigned Variables: Track the number of variables currently in use across your design.


Identify Unused Variables: Identify variables that are defined but remain unutilized within your document.


Fix orphaned Variables: Detect variables that were previously assigned but are no longer linked to any elements.

Error Detection: Variable Lint intelligently detects and flags errors related to variable usage, such as:


Nodes missing Variables: Highlight instances where variables should be used but are hardcoded instead. Identify areas where variables could enhance design consistency but have not been applied.


With Variable Lint, designers can elevate their variable management practices, promoting design system consistency and accelerating the design iteration process.


Buy me coffee

accepted.name: Sunny
accepted.description: Solving some of the use cases my team encounters when working in Figma.

plugins.name: Fluid Color Palettes
plugins.description:
Unleash the Power of Dynamic, Variable-Based Color Palettes in Figma


---

Generator your palettes: https://colors.fluid-design.io

Then paste the figma link into the plugin - And you're done!

---


When it comes to design, color is king—but managing your color palette shouldn't be a royal pain. Our Figma plugin simplifies the process like never before, allowing you to:


  1. Generate 1000+ Dynamic Variables with stepped-opacity: Instead of static color codes, receive variable-based palettes for total design flexibility. Switch between light and dark modes with zero manual adjustments. Then you can use your colors as variables like: color/primary/50, color/gray/100 or with opacity color/accent/500/95 or brand/foreground/70!
  2. One-Click Brand Palette Customization: Automatically generate a 'Brand Palette' designed for diverse use-cases like background, foreground, and more—all based on your chosen base colors.
  3. Seamless Design-to-Development Workflow: With one generated link, effortlessly integrate your palette into Figma and simultaneously generate color tokens for TailwindCSS and shadcn/ui. Ensure design consistency across platforms and speed up project timelines.


Close the Gap Between Design and Development

Our plugin doesn't just save designers time—it builds bridges between design and development teams. By generating unified color tokens, we ensure consistency and ease-of-use across various platforms. No more back-and-forths over color codes; just a single, harmonious workflow.


Affordable, One-Time Purchase

For a fixed one-time payment, gain lifetime access to all premium functionalities. Say goodbye to manual adjustments and accelerate your design workflow—it's a game-changing investment that pays off instantly.


The Science Behind the Palette—Simplified

We employ advanced color science to make sure your palettes are not just stunning, but functional. And for those concerned with accessibility, rest assured: our colors meet WCAG 2.1 and APCA standards. But don't worry about the complexities—our plugin does all the heavy lifting, so you can focus on what you do best: designing. And for those who're interested digging how these colors were picked, checkout the color science page.


Effortless Updates

Update your palette via our website at any time.


Ready to elevate your design workflow? Install our plugin today and experience the future of color management in Figma.

accepted.name: Oliver Pan
accepted.description: UX designer

plugins.tagline: Fully variable-based colors. TailwindCSS-styled palettes. shadcn/ui color theme.

plugins.name: Design Feedback
plugins.description:
Improve your UI designs with instant detailed design feedback. This intuitive plugin provides personalized, actionable feedback within Figma, streamlining your design process and enhancing the quality of your work.


What Does it Do?

  • Comprehensive Analysis: From visual hierarchy to usability, this plugin examines your design across several critical aspects, ensuring no detail is overlooked.
  • Balanced Review: It highlights what's working well and what needs improvement, providing a balanced perspective that respects your design's unique style.
  • Actionable Recommendations: You receive specific, easy-to-understand suggestions for improvement.
  • Inclusive Design Focus: With a keen eye on accessibility and responsiveness, it ensures your designs are universally usable and aesthetically pleasing across all devices.


How It Works

  1. Upload & Analyze: Select your UI frame and let the plugin dissect its elements.
  2. Receive Expert Feedback: Instantly get structured, insightful feedback.
  3. Refine & Excel: Apply the suggestions, elevate your design quality, and learn best practices.


Ideal for Aspiring and Seasoned Designers

"Design Feedback" is a game-changer, especially for novice and intermediate designers seeking to hone their skills. It offers clear, instructive feedback that's easy to implement. Experts will also find value in its fresh insights and design affirmations.


Why Choose Design Feedback?

plugins.name: Crunch Image Optimization
plugins.description:
Optimize Groups, Layers, and Images before adding them to your sites.


We all know that keeping up with image optimization can fall off the radar really fast when you are cycling through design and approval. Leaving a lot on the developer to clean-up. Thankfully with Dev Mode you can now optimize your images right in Figma. No more need to export images, run to another program or the web, then upload to your site or development flow.


Optimize and review your designs right in Dev Mode by using JPEG or PNG image compression.


  1. Source: Choose between the source* image or the layer itself
  2. Scale: Adjust the scale you want the image to be optimized in
  3. Quality: Adjust quality to fine-tune your image
  4. Inspect: Pinch zoom on trackpads or ctrlKey + scroll to zoom image or drag your image around to see inspect the optimization.
  5. Optimized images will be displayed in the lower section of the Inspect Panel.


*Your fill needs to be the top-most fill in the Fill panel

accepted.name: Dan Gavin
accepted.description: Digital Experience Engineer at https://bigcom.com

plugins.name: Otto
plugins.description:
Hello! Meet Otto.


Otto is a very special caterpillar who lives inside Figma. Otto is rather shy and avoids attention (especially if you look like a hungry bird).


No one quite knows how Otto burrowed his way into Figma. For years, Otto has survived by munching on discarded letters and words deleted from text boxes in Figma files.


Unfortunately for Otto, Figma developers aren’t big fans of bugs living in their software. So Otto does his very best to stay very hidden, living a quiet, calm life on the leaves of Figma’s gigantic node tree.


While Figma has countless users worldwide, few have actually seen even a glimpse of Otto in the wild … until today!


That’s because Otto has a secret superpower: He can type fast.


I mean, really, really, really fast.


Otto doesn’t like to brag about his special talent. But, if you ask him nicely to type something for you, he’ll do it. (While shy, Otto is always willing to help others.)


This plugin lets you send typing requests to Otto. Just use a special character to wake him up, then type in a single character that matches up to the words or sentences you want him to type out. 


Otto types so quickly, you still won’t be able to see him — but you’ll definitely see the trail of letters he leaves in his wake.


Thanks to Otto, you can be more efficient with text: Avoid typing the same word or sentence manually over and over. (This also gives Otto some much-needed exercise.)


This plugin even helps the environment! Otto types exclusively with 100% recycled text letters from deleted Figma files. (Fun fact: Otto has one of the world’s largest collections of the word “Untitled” for some mysterious reason.)


If you have a question for Otto, please share it in the comments and I’ll see if I can get an answer from him. (Usually, I have to get Otto to type something such as ‘Hey Otto! What’s up?’ to get his attention.)


-----


Finally, one minor FYI: Otto is usually very comfortable moving around in Figma, whether it’s a sticky note or a text box (he’s even been known to chew on the text in a connector arrow from time to time).


However, Otto is very skittish around code blocks and can’t wait to escape them (with so many coders hunting for bugs, I can’t blame him one bit). So if you ask him to type something in the middle of a code block, he’ll do it — but Otto will immediately dash to the end of the text. If you’d call this a bug … well, that bug’s name is Otto!

accepted.name: Nelson Taruc
accepted.description: My design philosophy: Focus. Boost signal, kill noise. Solve the first problem. Embrace uncertainty.

plugins.name: Visible Property
plugins.description:
Visible Property is a plugin for visualize your element property in just one click and you can “UPDATE” all text’s property when you update your element.


🎉 [Note] Visible Property #2 is now available (A bit geeky but more powerful)


Why?

When I create design system, I want to add text property to my design for easy visualization but the color will alway have little update. It’s pain to update the property all the time. Therefor I create this plugin to solve this problems.


How to Add text’s property

- 1. Select a Element

- 2. Navigate to the Plugins menu

- 3. Select “Visual Property”

- 4. Click “Add” property you want to visualize


How to Update text’s properties

- 1. Navigate to the Plugins menu

- 2. Select “Visual Property”

- 3. Click “Update All”. All the text’s property will update without changing style


TIP

** You can adjust style of visual property. The plugin will update only text, width and height without touching your style **


Video How to

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ADYg3AHJ5iY


Visual Property is open source, feel free to contribute or to send suggestions:

https://github.com/apirak/visible-property

plugins.name: Math-X - TeX/LaTeX to SVG
plugins.description:
"Math-X - TeX/LaTeX to SVG" is a plugin that converts TeX/LaTeX equations into editable SVG images. This tool enables you to create mathematical equations and formulas within your Figma designs.


How to Use:

  1. Type your TeX/LaTeX equation into the provided input field.
  2. Click "Create" to generate the SVG image, or enable AutoSync to update the SVG result in real-time.
  3. Drag and drop the resulting SVG directly onto your Figma canvas or use the insert button.


For easy future reference and editing, the plugin stores the original TeX/LaTeX equation in the SVG's frame name.


The official website: math-x.com

Created by Elia Jabbour
plugins.tagline: Convert TeX/LaTeX to editable SVG images.

plugins.name: LIGHT DSM
plugins.description:
中文使用说明请移步

https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/474580472


Light DSM plugin is an engineering design system application, it works simple: “Treat the design as a code engineering to build”


We use scientific way to abstract design specifications, provide efficient design resource management capabilities, and finally output design deliverables to developers. There will be many innovative ideas about design engineering, please look forward to it :)


We provide the ability to import icon library resources into the plugin and apply to the figma canvas in the current version.


Usage:

1.  Login account, please note that only Baidu account login is supported now

2.  Click the button in the upper right corner(“import resource library”)

3.  Search icon library resources from the Material Platform(material.baidu.com) (eg: Search for characters “light” in the search input)

4.  Click the "OK" button(bottom right corner) to import the icon resource


Icon resources are actually managed on the Material platform, DSM just call RESTful API, and the plugin supports synchronization of the icon library.


For more features, please look forward to subsequent versions.


Regards,


Thanks for your time :)


—— Development team of Light DSM

accepted.name: 王晓辉
accepted.description: 专注于工程化设计系统（DSM）

plugins.name: Variant Inspector
plugins.description:
Variant Inspector simplifies the process of accessing variant properties and conveniently placing them above your variant components. This tool is especially helpful for engineers when designing component APIs.


This plugin offers a quick solution, addressing the current gap in Figma, which does not yet integrate variant properties directly into the inspect panel.

plugins.name: Find & replace variables
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin: Find Replace Variables

This plugin is particularly beneficial when you have numerous variables with a similar naming structure, and you want to assign new variables by replacing parts of the variable names.


Functionality

The Find Replace Variables plugin locates and replaces variables in your Figma files. It accomplishes this by conducting a replace operation on the names of bound variables. You can do this by entering a simple string or a regex pattern.

Upon identifying the variables to be modified, the plugin will then search for variables with the new name, either locally or in any enabled library. If a match is found, it will substitute the old variable with the new one.


Usage

To use the Find Replace Variables plugin, follow these steps:

  1. Select the node(s) in your Figma file where you want to replace variables.
  2. Run the Find Replace Variables plugin with UI (Open) or in the Figma Quick Action Bar (Quick Run).
  3. Enter the string or regex pattern for the find operation.
  4. Enter the string or regex pattern for the replace operation.
  5. Run the plugin. It will replace all instances of matching variables within the selected nodes.


Example

If your variable names follow a specific structure and you often need to change multiple variables with the same naming structure, this is for you!


For example, if your variables are:

blue / 50
blue / 100
blue / 200
red / 50
red / 100
red / 200


You can change your design from blue to red by using “find and replace variables” blue → red with a single command.


Roadmap

  1. Add a preview component to the UI that checks for matching variables and replacement on the fly.


Features

  1. Supports all variable types
  2. Use normal text or regex
  3. Use UI or quick action menu


Get started

  1. Find and replace variables is free for 3 runs per file
  2. Use across an unlimited number of files
  3. No subscription fees
  4. Get individual lifetime access for a one-time fee of $69 (limited time offer).


Limitations

You can’t use this on instances that have bound variables as an override.


Why not free?

Despite being a very simple plugin, it saves you a great amount of time if you really need to use it more than 3 times per file. I put a lot of effort and time into developing this plugin, while I could have done client work. By valuing my work and supporting me, you enable me to work on other ideas that could potentially help you be even more efficient in the future.


Feedback

If you have any feedback or something doesn’t work, open an issue here.
plugins.tagline: Find & replace for all variables in your selection.

plugins.name: Toggle Spacers
plugins.description:
Toggle all your spacers with ease.


How to use this plugin:


  • Create a dedicated page for your spacer components and name it Spacers. Make sure this page only contains your spacer components and nothing else
  • Use your spacers freely, even in auto layouts (they will still occupy their space when hidden)
  • Toggle the visibility by using the Toggle Spacers → All command (say via the context menu)


If you want your spacers page to be named differently you may use the the Toggle Spacers → Select Page command to select a different page containing your spacers.


While similar plugins hide the actual instances of your spacer components, this plugin actually changes the components itself. This means that either all or no spacers will be visible at any given time.


The code for this plugin can be found at GitHub. Feel free to open an issue if you encounter any problems or have suggestions on how to improve the plugin.

plugins.name: Bynder
plugins.description:
Using the Bynder alongside Figma has never been easier. Connecting Bynder to Figma removes interruptions from your design workflow by enabling downloads from Bynder and providing access to your creative assets, stored in your asset bank, directly in Figma.


You can also upload and update assets in Bynder with your latest designs Figma.


You can begin a trial directly from the plugin, and use it with everyone in your organization. You can also send us an email if you have any questions or need help to get started.

plugins.name: Titleitos comment
plugins.description:
Titleitos: comment (Tiny)


Create titles and comments with a click of a button.

It's that simple.


Use a keyboard shortcut, or select Titleitos from your plugins menu (or just type it on cmd bar CMD+/) and that's it! you made a titleito!


If you select an Object / Frame and use the Titleitos plugin, the title will appear above on the y axis. If not, it will just float on your screen for fast use.


How to add a keyboard shortcut (Mac)?

  1. Go to System Preferences
  2. Search for Keyboard
  3. Click on Shortcuts tab
  4. Search for "App Shortcuts"
  5. Add Figma.app
  6. Click on the + and Type in: "Titleitos comment"
  7. Chose your shortcut by typing for example: CMD+Option+Shift+m
  8. That's it!


Enjoy!


(I made this plugin for my own use, but why not to share it?)

plugins.name: Smart Chroma
plugins.description:
Smart Chroma generates a color palette based on human vision.


If you create a color palette using a generic color space, the saturation and lightness of the appearance will appear to vary simply by changing the hue. This is because the saturation and lightness of the color space do not take human vision into account. This tool allows you to instantly and easily generate a color palette that takes human vision into account.


This tool is inspired by Color Space and uses the HCT color space internally. Source code available on GitHub.

accepted.name: ろぼいん
accepted.description: Creator

plugins.tagline: A color palette generator based on human vision.

plugins.name: Slope
plugins.description:
Introducing "Slope" - The Figma Plugin for Generating Serial Strings with Ease!


Are you tired of manually creating serial strings for your design projects? Look no further! Slope is here to revolutionize the way you generate serial strings in Figma.


Whether you're designing software interfaces, creating unique product keys, or working on any project that requires sequential identification, Slope will be your go-to solution. With its seamless integration into Figma, you'll have the power to generate custom serial strings in just a few clicks.


Here's why Slope is a game-changer:


  • Customizable Patterns: Slope provides a wide range of customizable patterns, allowing you to create serial strings that match your specific requirements. From alphanumeric combinations to specific character placements, the possibilities are endless.


  • Sequential and Random Modes: Choose between sequential and random modes based on your project's needs. Sequential mode enables you to generate serial strings in a precise order, while random mode creates unique strings at the click of a button.


Save time, eliminate errors, and boost your productivity with Slope. It's time to streamline your workflow and focus on what matters most – your design. Get the Slope Figma plugin today and unlock a whole new level of convenience and efficiency.
plugins.tagline: continuous string generator

plugins.name: Generative Contour Lines
plugins.description: Generative Contour Lines Generator allows you to create dynamic and customizable contour maps directly within Figma. Easily adjust parameters like grid size, noise intensity, contour line thickness, and color gradients to create visually stunning, organic shapes. With built-in smoothing options and random seed control, you can fine-tune the level of detail and replicate designs seamlessly. Perfect for creating abstract designs, topographic maps, and artistic backgrounds, this plugin gives you full control over the contour generation process and visual appearance.
plugins.tagline: Create dynamic and customizable contour maps with organic curves and vibrant color gradients
